evidence: By analyzing these patterns, clinicians can assess blood flow speed, direction, and uniformity through the cardiac cycle.
triples.o: blood flow speed, direction, and uniformity

evidence: The result is a spectrum showing how signal amplitude changes with Doppler frequency over time. Each vertical line in the display represents the distribution of frequencies - or velocities - at a given instant. When plotted together, this forms the spectral waveform, which you often see in clinical Doppler displays.
